org.numenta.nupic.algorithms

Class CLAClassifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.algorithms.CLAClassifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable

    public class CLAClassifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements Persistable
    A CLA classifier accepts a binary input from the level below (the "activationPattern") and information from the sensor and encoders (the "classification") describing the input to the system at that time step. When learning, for every bit in activation pattern, it records a history of the classification each time that bit was active. The history is weighted so that more recent activity has a bigger impact than older activity. The alpha parameter controls this weighting. For inference, it takes an ensemble approach. For every active bit in the activationPattern, it looks up the most likely classification(s) from the history stored for that bit and then votes across these to get the resulting classification(s). This classifier can learn and infer a number of simultaneous classifications at once, each representing a shift of a different number of time steps. For example, say you are doing multi-step prediction and want the predictions for 1 and 3 time steps in advance. The CLAClassifier would learn the associations between the activation pattern for time step T and the classifications for time step T+1, as well as the associations between activation pattern T and the classifications for T+3. The 'steps' constructor argument specifies the list of time-steps you want.
    Author:
    Numenta, David Ray
    See Also:
    BitHistory, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • verbosity

        int verbosity

      • alpha

        double alpha
        The alpha used to compute running averages of the bucket duty cycles for each activation pattern bit. A lower alpha results in longer term memory.

      • actValueAlpha

        double actValueAlpha

      • learnIteration

        int learnIteration
        The bit's learning iteration. This is updated each time store() gets called on this bit.

      • recordNumMinusLearnIteration

        int recordNumMinusLearnIteration
        This contains the offset between the recordNum (provided by caller) and learnIteration (internal only, always starts at 0).

      • maxBucketIdx

        int maxBucketIdx
        This contains the value of the highest bucket index we've ever seen It is used to pre-allocate fixed size arrays that hold the weights of each bucket index during inference

      • steps

        TIntList steps
        The sequence different steps of multi-step predictions

      • patternNZHistory

        Deque<Tuple> patternNZHistory
        History of the last _maxSteps activation patterns. We need to keep these so that we can associate the current iteration's classification with the activationPattern from N steps ago

      • activeBitHistory

        java.util.Map<Tuple,BitHistory> activeBitHistory
        These are the bit histories. Each one is a BitHistory instance, stored in this dict, where the key is (bit, nSteps). The 'bit' is the index of the bit in the activation pattern and nSteps is the number of steps of prediction desired for that bit.

      • actualValues

        java.util.List<?> actualValues
        This keeps track of the actual value to use for each bucket index. We start with 1 bucket, no actual value so that the first infer has something to return

      • g_debugPrefix

        java.lang.String g_debugPrefix

      • CLAClassifier

        public CLAClassifier(TIntList steps,
                     double alpha,
                     double actValueAlpha,
                     int verbosity)
        Constructor for the CLA classifier
        Parameters:
        steps - sequence of the different steps of multi-step predictions to learn
        alpha - The alpha used to compute running averages of the bucket duty cycles for each activation pattern bit. A lower alpha results in longer term memory.
        actValueAlpha -
        verbosity - verbosity level, can be 0, 1, or 2

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        public <T> Classification<T> compute(int recordNum,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> classification,
                                     int[] patternNZ,
                                     boolean learn,
                                     boolean infer)
        Process one input sample. This method is called by outer loop code outside the nupic-engine. We use this instead of the nupic engine compute() because our inputs and outputs aren't fixed size vectors of reals.
        Parameters:
        recordNum - Record number of this input pattern. Record numbers should normally increase sequentially by 1 each time unless there are missing records in the dataset. Knowing this information insures that we don't get confused by missing records.
        classification - Map of the classification information: bucketIdx: index of the encoder bucket actValue: actual value going into the encoder
        patternNZ - list of the active indices from the output below
        learn - if true, learn this sample
        infer - if true, perform inference
        Returns:
        Classification containing inference results, there is one entry for each step in steps, where the key is the number of steps, and the value is an array containing the relative likelihood for each bucketIdx starting from bucketIdx 0. There is also an entry containing the average actual value to use for each bucket. The key is 'actualValues'. for example: { 1 : [0.1, 0.3, 0.2, 0.7], 4 : [0.2, 0.4, 0.3, 0.5], 'actualValues': [1.5, 3.5, 5.5, 7.6], }

      • pFormatArray

        private <T> java.lang.String pFormatArray(T[] arr)
        Return a string with pretty-print of an array using the given format for each element
        Parameters:
        arr -
        Returns:
